file_content.text: C-come to watch me freeze, have you? Just g-go.
Why isn't my escort here yet?
Ha! Yes, you. Too late!
I heard you were coming after the regenerative armor, and I've destroyed my notes! You'll learn nothing!
I want the name of your informant. Now.
Who warned you?
This lab is surrounded, doctor. You may want to rethink which side you're on.
This is a chance to join us.
Never! I serve the Empire!
Oh, I think I will.
You--you don't scare me!
We're secure. The guards are lost, but two of my guys are missing, too. We're looking for them.
All clear. Lot of dead guards out there, but we're pretty banged up, too.
I claim immunity! Under Section 1138 of your Republic Charter, you cannot coerce or harm a political prisoner!
Uh-huh. But Hoth isn't in the Republic, now is it?
Rest assured, we are always mindful of the canons of the Republic.
I still follow the law.
I don't know, Jedi. Hang him up in a wampa cave, and he might start talking....
But... you wouldn't dare! You're bluffing!
Enough, Lieutenant. Doctor, helping us could make the difference between being a Republic prisoner, or a "guest."
Yes, he is. Let's negotiate.
Well, I... I'd want private quarters. With a lab. And HoloNet access!
I can't guarantee everything, but Jedi recommendations carry a lot of weight.
I'll try.
Hmph. I didn't expect you to be so reasonable. Now, the armor.
You'll have them. Once you hold up your end of the bargain.
Done. Now talk.
Very well. You're fortunate I have such an excellent memory.
A lab, maybe, but you can't be trusted with the HoloNet.
No HoloNet access.
Oh, fine. I'll have to make do. Now, I suppose you want to know about the armor.
The lieutenant hasn't hung anyone in a wampa cave for, oh, days now. He's getting withdrawal.
Oh, he does it all the time.
A spell in a wampa cave might do him good....
I like that idea.
Tell me all you know about the armor Valon stole.
[Force Persuade] Talk. Now.
Yes, I--I must tell you all about the armor.
The armor's healing function is impressive... see, this is based upon it. But the armor itself... can be overstressed.
Ever watch a mind being broken by the Force, doctor? It's quite horrific.
That means I can coerce you.
Uh, yeah. So you'd better... talk fast.
What? You can't! My mind is all I have!
I don't wish to harm you, but you're not giving me a choice.
Help me out here.
Tell me about the armor, and I'll leave you alone.
Then give me what I want.
All right! I'll tell you what you wish to know! Emperor forgive me.
That's a shame. But what's one more insane scientist in the Empire?
Pity. You're about to lose it.
Whoa, whoa! Jedi, take it easy!
No! Don't! I'll tell you everything! Just--no more!
You know Valon's armor has a unique healing function, yes? But that function can be... overstressed.
If Valon was mortally injured several times, quickly, the healing function would shut down, leaving him vulnerable.
Can the armor's healing functions be shut down any other way?
Is that the only answer?
No, they are too sophisticated. This is a crude method, but it will work.
Valon is a powerful opponent. Defeating him over and over will be difficult.
No easy task.
But you already beat him once--and that armor must be destroyed!
I look forward to trying it.
Sorry to interrupt, LT. We've spotted a group of Valon's men.
They're headed for a scavenger's camp. Should we engage them now? Or wait for you?
Cut off their escape route and hold back until I arrive.
Wait until I get there.
I'm open to your opinion on this.
Thoughts, Lieutenant?
Just make sure they can't escape and wait for us.
Take them by surprise. I'll be along shortly to finish the task.
Attack now.
Yes, sir. I'll pass it on.
Wait! Your Republic Charter states prisoners must be cared for. Without my equipment, this lab will soon freeze!
Forget it. I'm down two men already; I'm not wasting another to escort you home.
My people are walking wounded. I can't waste manpower escorting something like you.
If we ignore the Republic Charter we're no better than him. You can spare one man.
We must obey the law.
Lieutenant Iresso, assign someone to escort this man to safety. That's an order.
I'm in charge. We save him.
Okay, okay. I'll send someone for him. But we'd better get to that camp.
Nobody forced you to destroy your equipment, doctor. Goodbye.
I agree. We leave him.
As a prisoner, I demand that you--w--wait! Come back!
Get out, will you! I have work to do!
